content.prompt: At the instant shown, a spherical object is momentarily at rest in a fluid. Which of the following claims about the buoyant force on the object is correct?

choices.label: The magnitude of the buoyant force must be zero because the object is at rest.
The magnitude of the buoyant force may be zero or nonzero, depending on the density of the object.
The buoyant force may be directed upward or downward, depending on the density of the object.
The buoyant force is directed upward.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
